  • Method Details

    • throwExceptions

      public QueryBuilderConfig.Builder throwExceptions()
      Sets the query builder as throwing. This will cause any occurring exception to be wrapped into an QueryExecutionException and be thrown instead of logged.
      Returns:
      builder instance

    • withExceptionHandler

      public QueryBuilderConfig.Builder withExceptionHandler​(Consumer<SQLException> exceptionHandler)
      Sets the query builder exception handler. This will only have an effect if throwExceptions() is not called.
      Parameters:
      exceptionHandler - handler for exception
      Returns:
      builder instance

    • disableDefaultLogger

      public QueryBuilderConfig.Builder disableDefaultLogger()
      Disable the default logger.
      Returns:
      builder instance

    • notAtomic

      public QueryBuilderConfig.Builder notAtomic()
      Set that the queries are not executed atomic.

      When the queries are atomic they will be executed in one transaction. This will cause that no data will be changed if any query fails to execute.

      On default queries will be also executed atomic. This method just exists for convenience. No queries will be executed after one query fails in any way.

      Returns:
      builder instance

    • withExecutor

      public QueryBuilderConfig.Builder withExecutor​(ExecutorService executorService)
      Sets the executor service used for the completable futures.
      Parameters:
      executorService - executor service
      Returns:
      builder instance

      Returns:
